column4: Hello I'm running an old ubuntu 8.10 (compatability reasons) and i cannot connect to wireless networks. DHCPDISCOVER fails with any wifi-manager I've tried (network-manager, wifi-radar and rutilt) This is the output I get in terminal when running any of those wifi-programs: http://cxg.de/_df1114.htm  How do I fix this?
basil_kurian_:never ask to ask
can you paste bin 'iwconfig' and 'iwlist'
sorry no, the notebook is currently somewhere else. But I can tell you that It's the dell intel chipset on wlan0 and an ALFA awus036H I'm using. neither works.
not a hardware fault though, the parallel windows can use wifi
to fix the dhcpdiscover error... connect to a network with a dhcp server
the network definately has a dhcp server, as two other computers use that server. only this notebook fails at it.
sounds like your unable to connect to that network
yes. but why? do I have to deal with it™ or could you give me some pointers to further resources?
use iwconfig and iwscan to try and connect manually
see where it fails in that process
ok thanks for your time :)
ive heard other praise wicd for is ability to connect to wireless when nm fails
I've tried to install that once on that particular machine. as a result I lost most of my network config stuff.
well yeah its an entirely seprate system from NM
do you know if the nvidia GeForce 8400 G is supported in newer verseions of ubuntu (10.04+)
I'm using 8.10 because of alledgedly unavalibale drivers for that graphics card. (i.e. without them the fan doesn't work and the card idles at 80°C)
the nvidia site shows which cards are supported by the current blob, it should be
you can add aspell back in later, if you dont get a different spellchecker from the liberoffice install
how can i get a look at what's inside the libreoffice package? and what happens to my dictionaries?
dpkg -L <deb file>
im not sure ive never tried it
